data.title: Working at Audible in Cambridge
data.meta_description: Inspiration can be found around every corner at our Cambridge location. Our close-knit team of innovators are focused on creating advancements in technology, Cambridge is a place where forward-thinking teams collaborate on the stories of the future.
data.text:
Our Sound Designers Build Whole Worlds, One Audio Effect at a Time

Breaking celery. Stomping feet. Following dogs around all day. Audible sound designers do whatever it takes to get the right effect, while advancements like 3D audio help them to create ultra-immersive experiences for listeners. Learn More

Abhinav Mathur on Leading Purpose-Driven Teams

Audible’s Senior Vice President of Customer Care and the Global Center for Urban Development is helping to drive positive impact for our customers and communities. He shares what he loves about this work, as well as his methods for maintaining balance. Learn More

Shima Osaka Shows How Advocating for Yourself is Part of Stepping Up

When Shima Osaka went from being legal counsel to country manager for Audible’s service for Japan, there wasn’t a blueprint to follow, so she forged a new path to become a stronger leader. Learn More

Women at Audible Create Paths to Career Growth, Support and Friendship

Jamie Quiroz was hired at Audible well into the pandemic. With offices closed and employees working remotely, she didn’t have the usual chances to meet, get to know, and network with her new colleagues. Learn More

What It’s Really Like to Be a QA Software Engineer at Audible

Over the course of my career, which has now spanned over a decade, I developed a keen interest—and became highly skilled—at quality assurance. Learn More

What It’s Really Like to Be a Mobile Software Engineer at Audible

I always wanted to work on an app that had a huge customer impact and Audible is a life-changing app for a lot of people. Learn More

How I Reached a ‘New Storytelling Dimension’ and Grew the Career I’ve Always Wanted

“I love that Audible has a culture of listening that expands to our customers and our community.” Serena Lau, Director Audible Studios, IN shares with Fairygodboss about her inspiring collaborators, and how Audible empowers her as a leader. #insideAudible Learn More

Audible Named Among Built In: 100 Best Companies to Work for in 2022

At Audible, we value our employees and are consistently inspired by their stories. Because of them, we have been recognized as one of Built In's “100 Best Large Companies to Work For” in the US. Learn More

How Audible's Kathy Le Transitioned to Tech from Health and Fitness

Kathy Le, a Software Development Engineer who joined Audible by way of our Resilient Coders apprenticeship program, shares the most rewarding aspects of her new career in tech and how she made the leap from personal training to coding. Learn More

Andrew Tsao, Head of Product, Data Science & Analytics, is Ever an Optimist

Andrew Tsao encourages his teams to keep a positive outlook, trusting that research and experimentation will get them closer to solutions as they imagine and invent on behalf of our customers. Learn More

St. Jules Desir is Opening Doors for Others to Thrive at Audible

At Audible, finance manager St. Jules Desir found a work culture where he could thrive. Now he’s helping others grow successful careers with us through recruiting efforts and as co-leader of our Black Employee Network (BEN) impact group. Learn More

Susan Jurevics is Connecting Creators and Listeners Around the World

Audible’s EVP, Head of International shares her philosophy for leading our business outside the US marketplace, the importance of embracing ambiguity and change, and how her role perfectly combines her degrees in art and business. Learn More

Matthew Thornton is Helping to Shape Audible’s Story for Global Audiences

As Head of Global Corporate Affairs, Matthew Thornton works to ensure that Audible’s brand story reflects our passion for the artful telling of distinctive stories and our mission to make a positive impact on the cities we call home. Learn More

As Audible Turns 25, The Sonic Disruptor Shows No Signs Of Slowing Down: “There’s So Much More To Do

“To see where we are now and to still continue to lead in the space is just really exciting.” Diana Dapito, Head of Consumer Content, sat down with Forbes alongside Rachel Ghiazza, EVP, Head of US Content, to chat about the customer obsession that has driven our innovation since our very first download in 1997. Learn More

At Audible, This Former Book Editor Gets to Tell Stories in New, Creative Ways

After 10 years in the publishing industry, Irene Bigas found an opportunity to move beyond the print world and enter a new era of content: making audiobooks at Audible. Learn More

This Developer Has Cracked the Code on Work That Makes an Impact

Software development engineer Justin Cockburn loves his work building a listening experience that delights millions of customers every day, and doing it for a company that prioritizes well-being. He wants to inspire people to join him. Learn More

Life Inside Audible: Software Development Managers

Sonia Malik and Darlene Hart Rodgers, Software Development Managers at Audible, share how mentorship is a powerful tool when leading, how they amplify voices, and why they are so proud to continue driving innovation at the home of storytelling. Learn More

Life Inside Audible: Technical Program Managers

Hear from Ishan Parmar and Stacy Sarvis about their unique career journeys, and how technical program managers are bringing all the right voices into the room in order to ignite the imaginations of our listeners. Learn More

Life Inside Audible: Content

Director, Creative Development Ian Stearns and Associate Directors Keith Wooten and Franki De La Vega, share about the stories they’re excited to tell and how Audible amplifies diverse voices through our original content and talent pipeline programs, such as the Audible Emerging Playwrights Fund. Learn More

Our People Principles: Customer Obsession

“Customer Obsession should be your North Star.” Raphael Cedeno and Sandra Vivas share how our People Principles are fundamental to the work they do, and how our customers inspire us every day. Learn More

Our People Principles

Our People Principles are fundamental to Audible’s identity, guiding our decisions day to day, and year to year. They represent the promises we extend to our listeners, and each other. Learn More

Audible’s General Counsel Lori Landew on Defining Your Own Success

Throughout more than 30 years of working in entertainment law, Audible’s General Counsel Lori Landew has forged a unique career journey by following her passions. She shares what she’s learned about the importance of determining your own path. Learn More

At Audible, Employees Are Empowered To Own Their Career

Nontraditional career journeys are common at Audible. When interests inspire employees to go in a new direction, leadership is there to provide the resources and mentorship to guide them. Learn More

Our People Principles - Study & Draw Inspiration From Culture & Techno…

Our People Principles truly guide the way we work and are visible in everything we do. Hear from Audible employees on how they exemplify Our People Principles and “Study & Draw Inspiration From Culture & Technology” in their daily work. Learn More

Jenn Lee on Innovating at Audible

“I’m most proud of seeing the folks who work for me grow.” Meet Jenn Lee, the head of Audible’s creator marketplace. She shares about her impressive career journey, what led her to Audible, and her most fruitful sources of inspiration and imagination as she leads her team and innovates on behalf of our customers. Learn More

Pravi Besa on Women In Tech @ Audible

Meet Pravarna Besa, an associate director of product operations at Audible! She shares her experience as a member of our Women in Tech impact group, and how the group has helped her connect with others and find a sense of belonging at Audible. Learn More

Julia Molloy on Women In Tech @ Audible

Meet Julia Molloy, a lead product manager at Audible! She shares her experience as a committee member of our Women in Tech impact group, and how the group has supported her, empowered her to grow in her role, and helped her find her community. Learn More

Our People Principles - Activate Caring

Audible’s People Principles truly guide the way we work and are visible in everything we do. Hear from Audible employees on how they exemplify our People Principles and use “Activate Caring” in their daily work. Learn More

AJ Huaranca on Learning & Being Heard at Audible

“Whenever I wanted to learn something, it was Audible.” AJ Huaranca, a product manager at Audible, shares about his career journey, and why bringing your whole self to work is integral to collaboration and innovation. Learn More

Dushyanthi Pieris on Feeling Confident in Career Growth at Audible

“I definitely feel like I can bring who I am to the office.” Dushyanthi Pieris, SDE III and co-lead of the Women in Tech Impact Group, shares about the importance of representation in tech, and how mentorship empowered her to reach her goals. Learn More

Mariana Martins Proves That Data Science is Also for Artists

Audible’s senior director of marketing analytics, Mariana Martins, built a career that uses all her passions, from statistics to human behavior to art. Now she’s modeling this inclusive, whole-self approach for others in data science and tech. Learn More

Amazing Stories From Mike Stevens' 25 Years at Audible

Our head of safety management was the one who pressed the button that made Audible.com go live in 1997. Since then, he’s had a front row seat to some incredible moments in our history. He’s retiring this spring, so we asked him to share his favorites. Learn More

Summer Fest 2023

This year’s Summer Fest in Newark was a vibrant oasis of music, art, food, and entertainment. We danced to a silent disco, played a few rounds lawn games, enjoyed delicious festival food, created custom tote bags and posters with local artists, and captured long-lasting memories. Check out the highlights! Learn More

Our People Principles - Imagine & Invent Before They Ask

Audible’s People Principles truly guide the way we work and are visible in everything we do. Hear from Audible employees on how they exemplify our People Principles and use “Imagine & Invent Before They Ask” in their daily work. Learn More

Learn more about Audible's focus on Spectrum & Belonging

We create a meaningful work experience that celebrates the glories of the human spectrum. Spectrum and Belonging (S&B) goes beyond compliance and embraces our collective desire to fully embrace what it means to celebrate all of our differences and to be heard. Learn More

Explore Working With Us at Audible | Careers at Audible

The stories we share at Audible are only possible because of the unique voices of the diverse people who make up our teams. Our teams of dedicated professionals drive our company forward and keep us pursuing innovative and exciting new ways to share the spoken word. Learn More

Technology

Innovation drives all that we do, and we are constantly striving to develop the best experience possible for our customers. Our teams ensure that we are always pushing our technology forward by providing the tools we need to create sophisticated digital products that revolutionize storytelling. Learn More

Tech Internship

At Audible, we are creating the future of listening and constantly making sure our customers get the very best user experience possible. Our team of bold designers guide product development and the Audible customer journey. Learn More

London UK

With a team fully invested in the future of audio and utilizing the human voice to bring stories to life, our London office is a friendly and collaborative place to be a part of the Audible team. Learn More

Sydney AU

Our spacious, modern, and bright Sydney office provides our team with an inviting space to work, and our team is constantly inspired and motivated to create and share stories with the world. Learn More

Tokyo JP

Nature and tranquility inspire our employees in the up-and-coming neighborhood of our relatively new office in Tokyo. Our Tokyo team enjoys references to natural beauty as well as themes of technology and innovation as they help create impressive new ways to advance storytelling. Learn More

Mexico City

When it comes to inspiration, our Mexico City team is in luck: The city is home to world-class galleries and museums and is a hub of art, culture and anthropological wonders. We innovate and dream on behalf of our customers in an office building designed by an internationally renowned artist. Learn More

Customer Care

We want our listeners' experience with us to be as delightful and seamless as the stories they consume. Our dedication to providing exceptional customer experience is only rivaled by our own passions for the content we share. Learn More

Newark NJ

Since moving our headquarters to Newark, New Jersey in 2007, we’ve fallen more in love with our thriving and inspiring neighborhood. Newark is rich with culture and we’ve invested directly in our community as we strive to be good neighbors and a workplace where voices and ideas are heard. Learn More

Berlin, DE

Our Berlin office opened in 2004, and it has been a fun and innovative base for our team in Germany. Utilizing the space to collaborate both in work and in play, the office enjoys regular team events while keeping a focus on exploring new ways to share the power of storytelling with the world. Learn More

Singapore SG

Our close-knit team enjoys a bright and modern space in the One George Street skyscraper located in the heart of the Central Business District. The Singapore office provides a beautiful and light space, where our teams can embrace ambiguity and where fun is encouraged through the occasional table tennis or pool game. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Sophia Gottfried

Sophia Gottfried is a Communications Manager on our Global Corporate Affairs team. She uses her writing background to keep all of us at Audible connected with stories about employees and teams, initiatives, exciting new product and content launches, and more. Learn More

Product & User Experience

At Audible, we are creating the future of listening and constantly making sure our customers get the very best user experience possible. Our team of bold designers guide product development and the Audible customer journey. Learn More

Content & Audible Studios

We are dedicated to creating and sharing innovative and inspiring content with our listeners around the world. Our team of passionate, hard-working individuals keeps us focused on providing our customers with incredible storytelling experiences. Learn More

Global Insights & Data Science

Our customers get to escape to different worlds, travel to far off countries, and become completely immersed in exciting stories of all kinds. None of those unique experiences would be possible without the hard work and knowledge provided by our Global Insights & Data Science team. Learn More

Brand & Marketing

Stories have the ability to inspire us and transform the ordinary into the extraordinary. Our Brand and Marketing teams are doing just that by sharing our passion with the world. Learn More

People & Operations

A story is only as good as its characters. That’s why our People and Operations team has helped push us towards success. Assuring our company has empowered, distinctive voices, their expert knowledge, determination, and energy makes them a vital part of our work community. Learn More

Finance & Growth

Our customers get to escape to different worlds, travel to far off countries, and become completely immersed in exciting stories of all kinds. None of those unique experiences would be possible without the hard work and knowledge provided by our Finance & Growth team. Learn More

How to prepare for your virtual interview at Audible

We've moved most of our interviews to a virtual process to ensure the health and safety of our employees and candidates. Get detailed information to help you prepare for your virtual interview, set up the conferencing tool, and review FAQs to set you up for success. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Ben Culmer

Ben Culmer is a Quality Assurance Manager focusing on the Audible experience for Android. He joined us in 2016 and, like so many of our tech employees, is not only diligently working to make the Audible experience great for all our customers—he’s an avid user and listener too. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Britt McCombs

The dedicated individuals on our content teams scour the world for stories that inspire and entertain. Hear how Audible’s supportive culture, People Principles, and unique opportunities motivate Britt McCombs, a Sr Manager of Audible Originals, to work to create the best in audio entertainment every day. Learn More

How to prepare for your technical interview at Audible

Review the technical topics you may be asked during your interview to understand what you'll likely be asked to discuss and demonstrate. When reviewing the below topics, remember to keep the customer top of mind. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Kannan Ganesan

Kannan Ganesan, a Software Development Engineer II (SDEII), collaborates with our tech team to enhance Audible’s playback experience. Whether an Audible Original, audiobook, or podcast, his work contributes to the smooth and seamless listening enjoyed by millions worldwide. This concrete impact is what makes Kannan and many of our SDEs excited to come to work every day. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Kofi Appiah

Kofi Appiah is an Audible Senior Product Manager, bringing his extensive technical knowledge and his interest in business strategy together to solve problems on behalf of the customer. He shares what he loves about working in Product at Audible, as well as some advice for anyone interested in joining the team. Learn More

Our People Principles - Articulate The Possible & Move Fast To Make It…

Audible’s People Principles truly guide the way we work and are visible in everything we do. Hear from Audible employees on how they exemplify our People Principles and use “Articulate The Possible & Move Fast To Make It Real” in their daily work. Learn More

Tanya Kravstov on Building Your Team and Networking

“I joined Audible 7 years ago, and at that time I was a team of one.” Tanya Kravtsov , Head of Quality Assurance and Co-Lead of the Women in Technology Impact Group, shares her advice on building a career, networking, and starting a team from scratch. Learn More

Audible Celebrates LGBTQIA+ Stories from New York to London to Mumbai

“There is a great and profound difference between being accepted and being celebrated, and in an environment like Audible, the latter is truly felt during events such as this.” Learn More

Audible CFO Cynthia Chu Has Never Been Averse to Taking Risks

Cynthia Chu says that being the CFO of Audible has let her “grow my responsibilities in unexpected ways.” Since she joined Audible in 2015 her role has expanded. Learn More

Brad Maglinger Helps Create Campaigns that Spark Conversation

Brad Maglinger serves as Audible’s SVP, Head of Growth and Product Marketing. He joined us in 2021 to help drive customer experience and marketing, leveraging his extensive background with renowned global brands. At Audible, he guides teams tasked with creating campaigns that inform customers about new content and features—in ways that get them as excited as we are. Learn More

Michele Moncrieffe on Audible Pride

“There are so many allies at Audible that I've had the pleasure of getting to work with and getting to know.“Michele Moncrieffe, Associate Manager Content Lifecycle, shares about her experience being a member of Audible PRIDE, the importance of impact groups and advice on allyship. Learn More

Meet Stephanie, an SDE energized by how much customers love our product

“I am super excited to be working on a customer-facing team; it’s nice to point to an experience on Alexa and say, ‘I worked on that!” says Stephanie Diaz, software development engineer at Audible. Learn More

Learn more about Audible's focus on Spectrum & Belonging

We create a meaningful work experience that celebrates the glories of the human spectrum. Spectrum and Belonging (S&B) goes beyond compliance and embraces our collective desire to fully embrace what it means to celebrate all of our differences and to be heard. Learn More

This UX Designer Helps to Make Audible More Accessible for All

Growing up, Lisa Del Monte saw how much technology would have helped their grandfather, and it inspired them to make a difference in people’s lives. Now they lead Audible’s UX accessibility efforts, helping customers to connect with cherished stories. Learn More

Keeping Systems Safe & Secure with Continuous Integration

On February 3, 2022, PowerToFly hosted an esteemed panel of Audible's women leaders to share how using continuous integration can keep systems safe and secure. This networking and hiring event attracted software engineers interested in various opportunities at Audible. Learn More

Hub+Home: Reimagining the Future of Work at Audible

As vaccinations make it possible to return to something ‘closer to normal,’ what will the future of work at Audible look like? Learn More

‘Uniqueness Is Celebrated’: Exploring This Company’s Culture of Care

While it was Sally Sarpong’s love of books that initially drew her to Audible, it’s Audible’s people-first culture that has kept her there for nearly seven years. Learn More

Abby West Works to Amplify Stories from Across the Human Spectrum

Abby West is helping to create a new frontier in audio entertainment. After spending several years in print and digital journalism, she joined Audible as an editor in 2017, and in 2018, she co-founded the Black Employee Network (BEN), one of Audible’s employee-led impact groups. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Nicolas Sotomayor

Nicolas Sotomayor is an Associate Manager, Creative Development on our Content team. He joined us in November 2020 as a Production Coordinator for our studios in Newark, NJ, and has since relocated to our Culver City (Los Angeles), CA hub to work on Audible’s podcast offering for customers. We love that he brings his background in meditation and wellness to work as well—he even hosts sound baths for his teammates! Learn More

Get to Know Jeremy Strauser, Audible’s Head of Apps and Engagement

Meet Jeremy Strauser, Head of Apps and Engagement on Audible’s Product and Insights team. Jeremy joined Audible in 2018 and transitioned into his current role in 2021, where he leads a team of product managers focused on maintaining and enhancing our in-app experience. Whenever a customer uses a feature on the Audible app, Jeremy and his team have had a part in it. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Montez Flenoury

Montez Flenoury is a talent manager for Audible’s talent and casting department. He joined our company just over two years ago to help ensure that we cast some of the most exciting talent out there, and then make sure they have a best-in-class experience working with us. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Sachi Angle

Sachi Angle is a Product Manager working on a tech team that’s focused on the intersection of AI, data and platform. She’s excited about the possibilities that the rapidly evolving field of AI has to offer our customers as her team develops new features to make their Audible experience even better. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Emma Nguyen

Emma started as a tech intern with Audible while she was in college, where she says she had “one of the best summers in my life.” She accepted a full-time offer in 2020 as a software development engineer. Now Emma is an SDE II on the Audible on Alexa Quality Assurance team. Here’s why she loves working at Audible. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Oluwaleke Aina

Oluwaleke Aina is a Software Development Engineer working on the voice-controlled Audible experience on Alexa. Since joining us in 2018, he has been able to deepen his technological knowledge and abilities, all while working in a supportive, collaborative culture. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Franki De La Vega

Coming from a background in theater, Franki De La Vega was drawn to the exciting developments in audio entertainment and now helps to bring Audible Theater productions to the stage as well as households and headphones around the world. Here she pulls back the curtain on what it’s like to work at Audible. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Janine Jansen

Janine Jansen works as a Mobile Growth Marketing Manager on our APAC Performance Marketing team, focusing on reaching potential Audible customers in India, Japan, and Australia. Based out of our Sydney hub, she studies all the possible ways to get more people excited about Audible. Learn More

Audible Named Among 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators by Fast Company

We’re proud to be recognized as a place where inventive minds and diverse experiences are valued, and where employees are actively encouraged to use their ideas and talents to improve our customers’ lives. Learn More

Audible Wins 2021 Digiday Worklife Award

This year’s Worklife Awards winners capture responses and new directions, and exemplify how companies worked to adapt to these changes and more. The organizations the judges have selected adjusted to a series of new norms across 2021... Learn More

How He Built This: Don Katz on the Amazing Story of Audible’s Founding

The interview offers a behind-the-scenes glimpse into the challenges that Katz and the Audible team faced as they pioneered an entertainment category, starting with his struggle to gather support for his vision. Learn More

Study Shows Nearly Half of Kids are Listening to Audiobooks and Podcasts

There’s nothing like getting swept up in a great story, and at Audible we're proud to be doing the work that brings these stories to life for listeners across all geographies and ages. Learn More

Audible wins WorkLife 50 award by Digiday

We're proud to be recognized by Digiday as a WorkLife50 award winner! From professional development and tuition reimbursement programs, to flexible work and Audible Wellness initiatives, like weekly meditations and consultations with dietitians and clinical psychologists; we’re thrilled to be recognized as an employer who prioritizes employee's well-being and Work-Life Balance. Learn More

Sailaja Sikharam: From Engineer to Head of Content and Royalty Systems

Sailaja Sikharam joined us in 2005 as a software development engineer, back when our offices were located in Wayne, New Jersey. Over the last two decades, as Audible’s content, services, employees, and global customer base have grown, Sikharam has grown with us, taking on expanded management and directorial roles. Learn More

How Sabrina Crespo Helps Audible Keep Pace with Our Global Growth

When Sabrina Crespo joined Audible in 2016, she was immediately tasked with a daunting project—in fact, heading up a major transformation. She would be responsible for scaling Audible’s human resources’ technology, immigration, and operations, which had been combined into one centralized team, People and Places, to keep pace with employee growth. “I thrive on taking ambiguity, chaos and a blank slate, and then creating order and a foundation to build upon,” Crespo says. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Dominic Morgan

Dominic Morgan is an Associate Director of Data Product Management on our Product & Insights team. His team focuses on providing various other teams at Audible with the right tools for analyzing data, and helping them use that information to make decisions and design solutions that delight our customers. He’s also part of our employee-led impact group, Unidos, which works to amplify the voices of our Latino and Hispanic employees, content creators, and community. Learn More

Audible’s Razwan Karamat Ali Believes Finance Tells a Story of its Own

It might sound obvious that our Head of Global Finance and Accounting, Razwan Karamat Ali, has always been a “numbers guy,” but his passion goes beyond that, to the story the numbers tell. A certified public accountant (CPA), Ali joined Audible in 2016 as VP, Head of Global Financial Planning & Analysis, and since then, his team has grown considerably, becoming, as Ali says, “a truly global finance organization with one team mentality,” with scaled automated tools and standardized processes that support Audible’s worldwide operations and help drive business decisions. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Veronica Perez

Verónica Pérez is an Associate Director of Lifecycle Performance for Audible’s EU service. She joined us in 2019 to help launch our service for Spain after falling in love with listening to Audible. Working out of Madrid, she’s discovering ways to continually delight listeners throughout Europe. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Patricia Burgos

As Audible’s Director, Global Paid Media, Patricia Burgos is helping future customers around the world discover Audible. She joined us in 2018, coming from a career in marketing leadership at major media companies. Patricia also helped found our employee-led impact group Unidos, which works to amplify the voices of our Latino and Hispanic employees, content creators, and community. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Rhonda Adams Medina

As Audible’s Head of Business Affairs, Rhonda Adams-Medina heads up a team that helps facilitate the complex deals that enable us to acquire, develop and produce exciting original entertainment. And whenever an Audible Original is adapted for film or TV, her team manages those deals, too. The Harvard Law graduate came to us in 2022 with 25 impressive years of experience advising and securing deals for major entertainment companies. Learn More

Raphael Cailloux Finds Inspiration and Beauty in Data Science

Cailloux, who was born in Paris, is drawn to the Zen way of thinking about things, even numbers. When he first joined Audible, in 2015 at our Berlin hub, he was managing data science for our service in the EU, with a team of one data scientist. Now he oversees a worldwide team of about 75 employees who are helping our business make strong, data-driven choices in order to continuously evolve Audible’s offering and surpass our customer’s expectations. Learn More

Bernard Thomas Leads Audible’s Global Customer Support with Compassion

We may be biased, but we believe Audible’s customer support is really something special. Led by Bernard Thomas, Head of Global Support Operations, the team is motivated by a genuine love of helping people. This is apparent in the way our customer support representatives regularly form bonds with listeners and each other, embodying the culture of care we have worked to build and strengthen over the years. Learn More

Audible’s Head of UX Design Sandy Fershee Finds Inspiration Everywhere

Sandy Fershee is the embodiment of Audible’s People Principle “Study and Draw Inspiration From Culture and Technology,” deriving lessons, insight, and ideas from all around her, then applying them to her user-focused design ethos. She shares about this, as well as her hunger to see and experience the world, its people, cuisines and dances, and the value she finds in being an introvert. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Jessica Johnson Gale

Jessica Johnson Gale is an Operations Manager on Audible’s User Experience Research team (UXR). She joined us in 2018 as a contractor and quickly realized how much Audible’s impact work (and our commitment to her beloved hometown of Newark) aligned with her own values. Now a full-time employee, she has been helping our Product and Insights org study and analyze our customers’ experiences so we can continue delighting and surprising them. Learn More

Audible Unveils New Artworks in Phase Three of Newark Artist Collaboration

Audible proudly announced a new series of public artworks in Newark as the third phase of the Newark Artist Collaboration, its program amplifying the work of local artists and encouraging investment in Newark’s creative community. This phase of the collaboration, which first launched in 2021, builds around the recently erected monument of Harriet Tubman, Shadow of a Face, by Nina Cooke John, and amplifies underrepresented voices through the power of storytelling. Learn More

Audible Sound Bites with Nic Dacre

Nic Dacre is a Production Coordinator for Audible UK’s Production and Studios team. Based out of our London hub, he works closely with our in-house director and producers, and our external production partners, to ensure UK podcast production milestones are met. As part of Audible’s community impact work, Nic has also taught storytelling and podcast-production sessions for young incarcerated adults. Get to know more about him and the team here! Learn More

Sophie Plateau on Women@ at Audible

“If people want to be better allies in the workplace, it's so important that they listen, that they learn, and that they take action if necessary.” Hear from Sophie Plateau, Manager of Global Community Impact, on the importance of Impact Groups and how groups like Women@ provide a space for women and allies alike. Learn More

Audible’s Artist Collaboration Goes Global

In 2021, Audible launched the Newark Artist Collaboration (NAC) to offer ongoing opportunities to local artists and to encourage investment in the city’s creative economy. Now, with planning underway for the next phases of NAC, new collaborations have taken off in London and Berlin. Learn More

Identity School of Acting Participates in Voice Acting Module at Audible’s London Studios

Hear about the impact Audible’s collaboration with the Identity School of Acting is having on the next generation of performers in the UK. Learn More

Audible and Amazon MGM Studios Announce Podcast Slate in Series Development

Audible and Amazon MGM Studios, a leading entertainment company focused on the production and global distribution of film and television content, unveiled plans to co-develop and co-produce an impressive slate of Audible Originals as series in development. Learn More

Audible Unveils New Studio in the Heart of Berlin

Audible has a new studio in the heart of Berlin! The studio’s four state-of-the-art recording spaces, including a multi-cast recording studio and recording booths fit for podcast recording or solo narration, will enable us to create immersive audio stories featuring Germany’s top creative talent and inspire more listeners than ever before. Learn More

Building Relationships with Our Community in Cambridge

To define their community strategy, Audible leaders in Cambridge turned to our Activate Caring People Principle. “We’ve always been really excited about Activate Caring as a mission; we embraced it quickly,” says Jenn Lee, Director of Software Development. “So the first thing we did was say, ‘What does it mean for us?’” They decided to focus on how the 100-plus Cambridge employees’ technical skills could make the greatest impact. As an office of mostly engineers, “We decided to give back leveraging our technical strengths.” Learn More

Speaking to an Identity - Audible and The Loop Lab 2023

Audible and The Loop Lab collaborated on a series of short films to shine a light on the challenges that many are facing in the City of Cambridge (and beyond). This video showcases ESL students as they share about their experience in the public school system. Learn More

Stories of Black Liberation Give Voice to Harriet Tubman Monument

“Harriet Tubman’s legacy and the stories of liberation through our own community have now come to life,” says fayemi shakur, Director of Arts and Culture for the city of Newark, about Audible’s first-ever public audio installation created for Shadow of a Face, the recently erected monument of Harriet Tubman in Newark’s Harriet Tubman Square. Learn More

Listening is at the Heart of Diana Dapito’s 20-Year Career at Audible

Today, people around the world know Audible as a leading provider and producer of audio storytelling with 900,000 titles in our catalog, thousands of Originals, and millions of customers. But when Diana Dapito joined us in 2004, it was still early days for digitizing audiobooks, magazines, speeches, and more, so people could carry and access them on portable devices. Dapito’s first role involved adding a handful of new titles to the catalog each week. Learn More
